com.horse.pokemon.ObjectData.Players

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • com.horse.pokemon.ObjectData.Players.AbstractPlayer
        • com.horse.pokemon.ObjectData.Players.User

  • public class User
extends AbstractPlayer
    The User class represents the protagonist of the Pokemon game. The MainGameScreen.camera revolves around a User instance by following the User when moving. The User moves by key presses of the arrow keys, and other actions are represented with other various keys.

    Actions with the corresponding key:

    • Up Arrow - Moves the User upwards.
    • Down Arrow - Moves the User downwards.
    • Right Arrow - Moves the User to the right.
    • Left Arrow - Moves the User to the left.
    • Shift (Both) - Alters User action by running if on land.
    • X Key - Various actions depending on the situation:
      • Asks to swim when next to a Water tile.
      • Dialog appears from being next to a Sign.
      • Speaks to an NPC with a Dialog.
      • Progresses a conversion through the Dialog.

    The User can go through a battle and have Pokemon from progressing through the Game. Pokemon are obtained by the User by 'catching' them with things called Pokeballs, which can be bought from a store called the Pokemart. There should only be a single User instance per Game, otherwise the MainGameScreen.camera will have a hard time determining which User to follow and all keyboard actions will cause both Users to act identically.

    The User is drawn onto the MainGameScreen by the draw(Batch, float) method, which is called every frame by the MainGameScreen.render(float) method. It is important that the userSprite is updated according to the delta time, AbstractPlayer.getDirection(), and getCurrentState(), as the animation adds realism to the Game. It is also good to not that the User is an AbstractPlayer which is also an Actor, meaning that the User is to be a part of a Stage.

    There are many different actions that the User can execute:

    • Idle - Non-moving action.
    • Walking - User moves at a decent pace on land.
    • Running - User moves at a quick pace on land.
    • Biking - User swiftly glides through the ground on a bike (And of course on land).
    • Swimming - User travels at a decent pace on Water.
    • Using HM Move - User uses a Pokemon in order to accomplish some sort of in-game task.
    • Fishing - User uses a fishing rod to obtain an item or encounter a Pokemon in the Water.
    • In Battle - When the User is fighting against another AbstractPlayer, adding a lot of functionality to the Game, and allowing the Pokemon to level up.

    For setting up a Screen for a User to be in, an Engine is required to be in the Screen. The User must be extended with the constructor changed as it requires a MainGameScreen, not just a Screen, as the major values in the MainGameScreen are required for the User to use to function properly. Another way could be to have a new class extend MainGameScreen and work from there.

    In order to create a User in the Screen.show() method of a Screen, an example is: 

         private MultiTmxMapLoader mapLoader;
     private MultiTiledMap[] maps;
     private MapCreator mapCreator;
     private User user;

     public void show() {
         mapLoader = new MultiTmxMapLoader();
         maps = mapLoader.loadAllMaps(Maps.TWINLEAF_TOWN.getTmxPath(), Maps.ROUTE_201.getTmxPath())
         mapCreator = new MapCreator(this, maps);
         user = new User(this);
     }

    To draw the User onto the Screen, in the Screen, add: 

         private Stage stage;

     public void show() {
         stage = new Stage();
         stage.addActor(user);
     }

     public void render(float delta) {
         stage.act(delta);
         stage.draw();
     }

    At the end, remember to dispose of the Stage when the Game ends, by doing: 

         public void dispose() {
         stage.dispose();
     }

    Finally, to get a OrthographicCamera to follow the User, an example is: 

         private static final int WORLD_WIDTH  = 720;
     private static final int WORLD_HEIGHT = 640;
     private static final int ZOOM_SCALE   = 2;
     private OrthographicCamera camera;
     private Viewport viewport;
     private MultiTileMapRenderer renderer;
     private SpriteBatch batch;

     public void show() {
         camera = new OrthographicCamera();
         viewport = new FitViewport(WORLD_WIDTH / ZOOM_SCALE, WORLD_HEIGHT / ZOOM_SCALE, camera);
         if(batch == null) {
             batch = new SpriteBatch();
         }
         renderer = new MultiTileMapRenderer(1.0f, batch);
     }

     public void render(float delta) {
         user.update(delta);

         camera.position.x = user.getPositionX();
         camera.position.y = user.getPositionY();

         camera.update();
         renderer.setView(camera);
     }
    See Also:
    Stage, AbstractPlayer, Actor, AnimationInterface, TextureRegion, Animation, HandleInput, MapCreator, Sprite, Rectangle

      The byte representing the amount of pixels from the upper-most part of the User to the bottom-most part of the User when in the PlayerActions PlayerActions.SWIMMING or PlayerActions.IDLE if the User is on water, also determining how big the user is drawn every frame y-wise.

      The byte representing the amount of pixels from the left-most part of the User to the right-most part of the User when in the PlayerActions PlayerActions.SWIMMING or PlayerActions.IDLE if the User is on water, also determining how big the user is drawn every frame x-wise.

      void update(float deltaTime)
      Checks User values and updates them according to actions made in handleInput(float).
      private void updateActorXY()
      Sets the position of the Actor part of the User relative to the position values so that the MainGameScreen.camera can follow the User properly, as the positions inside User are offset because the position is the bottom left corner of the User.
      private void updateAlignment()
      Checks if the User if correctly placed onto a tile so the User knows to stop moving if handleInput(float) gets no feedback.
      private void updateAnimation(float deltaTime)
      Updates the frame of the User by the amount of time that has passed.
      private void updateCurrentCollisionRectangle()
      Alters AbstractPlayer.currentCollisionRectangle using AbstractPlayer.setCurrentCollisionRectangle(Rectangle) according to the position of the User and tile size.
      private void updateSwimming()
      Checks whether the User is on Water or not by getting the collision box of the User.

      • resetPosition

        public void resetPosition(MapCreator mapCreator,
                          boolean resetMapCreator)
        Takes a different MapCreator and extracts the MapCreator.startPosition information to set the User position to it. Also, the AbstractPlayer.mapCreator will be changed if resetMapCreator is true.
        Parameters:
        mapCreator - New instance of a MapCreator to set a new position.
        resetMapCreator - Determines if the value of AbstractPlayer.mapCreator is altered to the mapCreator parameter.
        See Also:
        MapCreator, MapCreator.startPosition, AbstractPlayer.mapCreator

      • getFutureRectangle

        private com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle getFutureRectangle(float offsetX,
                                                           float offsetY)
        Returns a Rectangle instance representing a future position of the User or the position of a CollidableTileObject.
        Parameters:
        offsetX - X-Position difference between the new x-position and the User x-position.
        offsetY - Y-Position difference between the new y-position and the User y-position.
        Returns:
        Rectangle instance of the future position of the User or the position of a CollidableTileObject.

      • handleInput

        public void handleInput(float deltaTime)
        Updating every frame, checks the user input and reacts upon specific Input.Keys presses.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - Time between frames.

      • isColliding

        private boolean isColliding(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle rectangle,
                            boolean activateCollisionMethod)
        The method isColliding checks to see whether a Rectangle instance overlaps with any of the CollidableTileObjects in MapCreator.collidableTileObjects. According to whether activateCollisionMethod is true or false, the CollidableTileObject.onCollide() will be notified if a collision is present.

        For Water overlapping, the method will ignore the collision as Water does not have the same properties as other CollidableTileObjects like Barrier. As for Doors, the Door.onCollide() method will be called and the Door instance will start transitioning to the next room.

        Parameters:
        rectangle - Rectangle instance to check among all other obstacles in MapCreator.collidableTileObjects.
        activateCollisionMethod - Value for whether or not the CollidableTileObject.onCollide() is to be called if there is a collision.
        Returns:
        Value of if there is a collision between the Rectangle instance and values in MapCreator.collidableTileObjects.
        See Also:
        Rectangle, CollidableTileObject, CollidableTileObject.onCollide(), MapCreator.collidableTileObjects, Door, Water, Barrier

      • getCollidingTileObject

        private CollidableTileObject getCollidingTileObject(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Rectangle rectangle)
        Gets the CollidableTileObject that has the same positions as the Rectangle instance inputted. A null value is returned if no object ends up being found from the current map.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - Rectangle instance to check if there is a similar CollidableTileObject in the current map.
        Returns:
        CollidableTileObject that has similar values to the inputted Rectangle.
        See Also:
        CollidableTileObject, Rectangle

      • getHandleInput

        private HandleInput getHandleInput()
        Returns the HandleInput to check for general key presses with HandleInput.update(float).
        Returns:
        handleInput

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        Checks User values and updates them according to actions made in handleInput(float).
        Specified by:
        update in class AbstractPlayer
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - Amount of time between each frame.

      • draw

        public void draw(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch batch,
                 float parentAlpha)
        Method for drawing the User onto the Screen, based on the movement and action of the User.
        Specified by:
        draw in class AbstractPlayer
        Parameters:
        batch - Drawing tool.
        parentAlpha - Alpha value to add transparency to all children.

      • updateAlignment

        private void updateAlignment()
        Checks if the User if correctly placed onto a tile so the User knows to stop moving if handleInput(float) gets no feedback.

      • updateSwimming

        private void updateSwimming()
        Checks whether the User is on Water or not by getting the collision box of the User.

      • updateAnimation

        private void updateAnimation(float deltaTime)
        Updates the frame of the User by the amount of time that has passed.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - Amount of time between each frame.

      • updateActorXY

        private void updateActorXY()
        Sets the position of the Actor part of the User relative to the position values so that the MainGameScreen.camera can follow the User properly, as the positions inside User are offset because the position is the bottom left corner of the User.

      • getFrame

        private com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion getFrame(float deltaTime)
        Gets the current TextureRegion representing the frame that the User is at according to its getCurrentState() value and time that has passed by.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - Amount of time between each frame.
        Returns:
        TextureRegion instance of the frame the User will use to draw onto the mainGameScreen.

      • getCurrentState

        private PlayerActions getCurrentState()
        Finds the current action of the User and returns the type of action.
        Returns:
        Action the User is performing at the current frame.
